page_content: Trade Result: LOSS (-$550). Strategy: Breakout (Buy). Market Regime: Low Volatility (Range). Context: Price broke 2350 resistance by 2 ticks and immediately reversed. Volume was low (below 20-period MA). Resulted in a bull trap.

metadata.lesson: Never trade breakouts when ADX is below 20. It is usually a fakeout.

page_content: Trade Result: WIN (+$1,200). Strategy: Trend Pullback (Buy). Market Regime: Strong Bull Trend. Context: Gold was making higher highs. Waited for a pullback to the 20 EMA on the 15m chart. Entered on a bullish engulfing candle. Held until previous high.

metadata.lesson: Trend is your friend. 20 EMA checks usually hold in strong trends.

page_content: Trade Result: CATASTROPHIC LOSS (-$1,500). Strategy: Mean Reversion (Short). Market Regime: News Event (CPI). Context: Tried to fade the initial spike after CPI data. Volatility expanded massively. Spread widened to 60 pips. Stop loss slipped significantly.

metadata.lesson: Do not stand in front of a freight train. Never fade the first 15 mins of a Red Folder event.

page_content: Trade Result: LOSS (-$300). Strategy: Support Bounce (Buy). Market Regime: Trend Following Bear. Context: Price hit a major daily support level. I bought immediately. The bear trend was too strong, and price smashed through support without pausing.

metadata.lesson: Don't catch a falling knife. In a strong bear market, supports are meant to be broken.

page_content: Trade Result: WIN (+$400). Strategy: Range Scalp (Short). Market Regime: Range (Asian Session). Context: Price hit the top of the Bollinger Band during the quiet Asian session. RSI was 70. Shorted with a tight stop. Targetted the middle band.

metadata.lesson: Mean reversion works best when volume is low and market is sideways.

page_content: Trade Result: BREAK EVEN ($0). Strategy: Breakout. Market Regime: Choppy/Undefined. Context: Entered a breakout, price moved 10 pips, then stalled. I recognized the lack of momentum and manually closed the trade early before it reversed.

metadata.lesson: Aggressive trade management saved capital. If a breakout doesn't go immediately, get out.

page_content: Trade Result: LOSS (-$800). Strategy: Revenge Trade (Long). Market Regime: Trend Following Bear. Context: After getting stopped out on a Short, I flipped Long immediately out of anger/confusion, thinking 'it must reverse now'. It didn't.

metadata.lesson: Psychological tilt. Never flip direction immediately after a loss without a new setup.
